newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexican feeder head weekly exports, imports - USDA.
newsitem.headline: Mexican feeder head weekly exports, imports - USDA.

text.p: USDA said Friday that steer calves and yearlings exported to the United States from Mexico sold mostly steady in the past week.
Exports for the week were estimated at 5,000 head into Texas and New Mexico. Confirmed exports for the previous week totaled 7,109 head, against 3,284 head in the same week in 1996.
"Trade moderate, demand good. Bulk of supply consisted of medium and large steers weighing 300-600 lb," USDA said.
"Also several lots of corriente steers crossed this week. Fifty percent of cattle imported crossed at Santa Teresa, New Mexico on Monday," it added.
Prices for feeder steers weighing 300-400 lb were 78-88 cents/lb, for 400-500 lb they were 70-78 cents/lb and 500-600 lb they were 68-70 cents/lb
Imports into Mexico were estimated to have totaled 3,000 slaughter head for the week with good demand, it added.
((--Chris Aspin, Mexico City newsroom (525) 7289530. E-mail at chris.aspin@reuters.com))
